job_description: IT Governance Analyst (Operations, Reporting, Projects) (Hybrid/Onsite) - job post Visa 1,066 reviews Foster City, CA • Hybrid remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Encouraged to Apply Fair chance Job Type Full-time Company Description Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement. Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone. Job Description Organization Summary The Technology Planning and Business Operations organization provides key business management oversight and integration across the Technology organization. This includes driving investment planning & budgeting, program/project portfolio management, workforce planning activities, strategic initiative program management, and communications activities. The team is focused on improving efficiencies, transparency, consistency and collaboration within the Technology organization and other key cross-functional stakeholders. Position Summary The Business Analyst will be primarily responsible for supporting Technology portfolio reporting, including various management reports/dashboard with standard cadence and all required data analysis. This position interacts with many cross-functional stakeholders, including various Technology teams, Finance, and many business function leads. This position will report to the Senior Director of Technology Planning and Business Operations and will interact with senior leadership. Key responsibilities include, Deliver project and program reporting, create summaries and overviews of investments, and review content / insights from stakeholders’ status commentary to ensure content quality for executive-level program/project reporting. Integrate reporting with day-to-day governance practice to drive compliance. Develop KPIs, dashboards, and other program health tracking to provide visibility to key stakeholders on projects and programs. This will include working with key stakeholders to define key performance measures and driving analytics. Extract, combine and transform raw data from various source systems to present meaningful insights for management decisions. This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs. PLEASE NOTE: NO RELOCATION, NO SPONSORSHIP SUPPORTED FOR THIS POSITION Qualifications Basic Qualifications 2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD) Experience with one or more reporting systems such as SQL, Excel, MS Access and Analytics tools such as Tableau, Power BI, OBIEE, etc. to develop dashboards Preferred Qualifications: 3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) Experience in the Payments and/or Technology industry a plus 5+ years of proven experience in business analytics, reporting, and data visualization. Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills with an attention to detail. Demonstrate ability to effectively communicate technical and business issues and solutions to multiple organizational levels Ability to summarize and communicate key financial information and business data at an executive level. Ability to work independently with strong time management with sense of urgency and ability to execute on multiple concurrent deliverables Ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities, assignments, and roles. PMP, Lean Six Sigma, or similar certification preferred. Additional Information Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department. Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time. Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers. Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law. Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code. U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 92,600.00 to 118,000.00 USD, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity.Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.

Architect - Content Management (SharePoint/365 Platform) - job post Exelixis, Inc. 13 reviews Alameda, CA 94502 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time SUMMARY/JOB PURPOSE: The Architect, Content Management is responsible for transforming the way employees work with content at Exelixis. As part of the ECM team, this role will be responsible for implementation and adoption of all layers of Content Management services using M365 tools such as SharePoint, OneDrive and Teams. As a Content Management architect, this role will help accelerate employee productivity across Exelixis by helping them effectively adopt M365 tools and services. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Analyzing, designing, developing and implementing SharePoint solutions. Support and administration for SharePoint, OneDrive and Teams. Work with users to translate their business needs into solutions using the Microsoft 365 tools (SharePoint, OneDrive and Teams). Document business processes for Enterprise Content Management, develop comprehensive functional requirements, and work closely with technical team members to deploy the right solutions for our users. Be the SharePoint subject matter expert for Exelixis and facilitate end user adoption by engaging with them to improve SharePoint usability and performance. Help users understand how to use the Microsoft 365 environment effectively and engage with them to ensure they are following best practices and methodologies as defined by the Enterprise Content Management team. Lead migration efforts from other systems to SharePoint online. Create and maintain technical documentation for the Microsoft 365 environment including detailed architecture diagrams, helpdesk manuals, installation and configuration manuals, operational procedures. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS: Education: Bachelor’s degree in related discipline and nine years of related experience; or Master’s degree in related discipline and seven years of related experience; or PhD degree in related discipline and two years of related experience; or Equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience/The Ideal Candidate will have: Demonstrated experience with the Microsoft 365 productivity tools such as SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, Viva and PowerApps Experience as a solution architect delivering complex business process solutions especially with regards to Enterprise Content Management Experience with agile methodologies such as Scrum Hands on technical management experience leading technical teams with M365 experience Excellent blend of technical and business analyst skills At least 5 years of experience building solutions on SharePoint Experience with migration tools such as Sharegate, Avepoint or others Knowledge/Skills: Ability to multitask, work collaboratively across a matrix organization and ensure flexibility in a dynamic corporate and team environment Ability to leverage both internal and external resources to expedite and deliver projects Ability to work in a team environment, create timelines, and continually make necessary adjustments Excellent writing, presentation, and oral communication skills Understanding of Records and Information Management is a huge plus WORKING CONDITIONS: Environment: primarily working in an office environment #LI-MK1 If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us! DISCLAIMER The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
